text:
My favorite hobby is reading books. I started reading seriously when I was in middle school, after a teacher recommended a story collection to me. Since then, I have developed a deep love for books of all kinds—novels, biographies, and even self-improvement guides.

I enjoy reading because it allows me to travel to new worlds without leaving my room. Through stories, I can experience different cultures, meet fascinating characters, and imagine situations far beyond my daily life. Reading also helps me relax; after a stressful day, immersing myself in a good book feels like entering a peaceful escape.

Another reason I enjoy this hobby is that it continuously teaches me something new. Books broaden my vocabulary, sharpen my thinking, and improve my ability to express ideas clearly. Non-fiction books, in particular, give me practical knowledge about history, science, and personal growth.

This hobby benefits me in many ways. It strengthens my focus, enhances my imagination, and even improves my communication skills. Most importantly, it makes me more empathetic, as I can see the world from different perspectives.

In short, reading is more than just entertainment for me—it is a lifelong companion that enriches my mind and shapes who I am.

text:
My favorite hobby is reading books. I started reading when I was a small child in school. At first, I liked reading short storybooks with pictures, but later I began reading bigger novels and other types of books. Reading makes me very happy because it takes me to a new world. When I read a story, I can imagine the characters, places, and events in my mind. It feels like traveling without moving anywhere.

Reading is also very useful. It helps me learn new words and improves my English. I also get new knowledge about science, history, and life. When I feel bored or stressed, reading gives me peace and relaxation. It makes my mind fresh and active again.

I believe reading is a good habit that gives both fun and learning. That is why reading is not just my hobby, but also my best friend.This is  lkhgk djflg  kjd

text:
My hobby is reading book. I start read when I small boy in school. First I read small story, comic, picture book. Slowly I read big book also. Reading make me happy. When I read, I feel I go new world. I see many place, many people, many idea. I no need travel, but I feel travel in story.

Reading also give me knowledge. I learn new word, new thing, new lesson. It help my English little bit. When I feel sad or stress, I take book and read. Then mind feel relax, calm.

Book also give me imagination. I can think more big, more different. Reading is not only fun, it also good for brain. That why I love reading. It is my best hobby.
I believe reading is a good habit that gives both fun and learning. That is why reading is not just my hobby, but also my best friend.

text:
I remember a time when I worked in a team for a school science project. Our task was to make a model of the solar system. At first, everyone was thinking their own ideas. But we learned to share our thoughts and listen to each other. That is what teamwork means: helping each other and working together.

We divided the work. I made the planets from clay, another friend painted them, and someone else made the labels. We also helped each other when someone had a problem. For example, I did not know how to make Saturn’s rings, so my friend showed me. This made the work faster and better.

During the project, we had some arguments, but we talked calmly and solved them. I felt happy when everyone worked together. I realized that teamwork is not only about sharing work but also understanding each other.

In the end, our project looked very nice. The teacher appreciated our effort. I learned that teamwork is important in life because it teaches cooperation, patience, and responsibility this is what i have done

text:
My favorite place is the park near my house. It is big and green. There are many trees, flowers, and benches. The air is fresh, and I can hear birds singing. I like the small playground where children play.

I go to the park every morning. I walk on the path and sometimes play football with my friends. I also sit on a bench and read books. Sometimes, I take photos of flowers and trees.

The park is important to me because it makes me happy and relaxed. I feel calm when I sit under a tree. I also meet my friends there and talk about school and games.

I enjoy spending time in the park. It is a place where I can play, learn, and rest. I always feel good when I leave the park.

To improve, focus on adding more specific details to enhance the description and elaborate on the personal feelings to make them more impactful and relatable.

text:
Sketching is my favorite hobby. I started it in childhood, tracing shapes and filling pages with quick lines. It grew into a daily habit.

I enjoy the quiet focus and the small, steady satisfaction of turning observation into marks. Sketching sharpens my attention and teaches me to notice light, texture, and proportion.

It makes me calm and energized at once — relaxed while alert, patient while curious. After a sketch I feel clearer, more present, and ready to take on the rest of the day. I sketch whenever ideas or calm moments appear.This is all about what i think about

text:
My favorite hobby is reading books. I started this hobby when I was in school, and since then it has become an important part of my life. At first, I used to read storybooks, but later I began exploring novels, biographies, and self-help books.

I enjoy reading because it takes me to different worlds and teaches me new ideas. Books help me imagine things that I have never seen before. Sometimes, I also learn useful lessons that I can apply in my daily life.

Reading makes me feel relaxed and happy. It reduces stress and gives me peace of mind. Whenever I feel bored or upset, I pick up a book, and it always lifts my mood.

text:
Climate change is one of the biggest challenges of our time, and everyone has a role to play in solving it. Some people believe only governments and industries are responsible, but individual actions also make a big difference.

Each person can reduce their carbon footprint by using less plastic, saving electricity, recycling, and choosing public transport. Small actions may seem unimportant, but when millions of people do them, the impact becomes powerful.

Of course, governments must create strong policies, but individuals cannot wait for them alone. Responsibility begins with us. By making eco-friendly choices in our daily lives, we contribute to a safer planet for future generations.

text:
Climate change is one of the most pressing challenges of our time, affecting ecosystems, economies, and human health worldwide. While governments and corporations possess the resources and authority to enact large-scale policies and technological changes, individuals also play a crucial role in combating climate change. This essay argues that although systemic action from governments and companies is essential, individuals have a real and meaningful responsibility to contribute to the fight against climate change.

Firstly, individual actions collectively shape demand, which in turn influences corporate and governmental decisions. For example, when more people choose to use public transportation or electric vehicles instead of gasoline-powered cars, it reduces overall carbon emissions and pushes the automobile industry to invest in cleaner technologies. Similarly, consumers who prefer eco-friendly products encourage companies to adopt sustainable production methods. These small choices may seem insignificant on their own, but together they create powerful market shifts.

Secondly, individuals have a direct impact on energy consumption and waste reduction at home. Simple actions—such as turning off unnecessary lights, reducing water usage, composting organic waste, and recycling—help reduce greenhouse gas emissions. For instance, if households worldwide reduced food waste by half, millions of tons of methane, a potent greenhouse gas, could be avoided each year. These measures are affordable, accessible, and collectively significant in mitigating climate change.

However, it would be unrealistic to place the primary burden solely on individuals. Governments and corporations control large-scale industrial emissions, infrastructure development, and energy production—areas where personal choices have limited influence. For example, without policies that regulate emissions from factories or promote renewable energy, the efforts of individuals alone cannot offset the vast amount of greenhouse gases produced by industrial sectors. Thus, systemic changes led by authorities are indispensable.

Critics argue that emphasizing individual responsibility distracts from the need for structural reforms. While this concern is valid, personal actions and advocacy can complement rather than replace institutional efforts. By voting for environmentally conscious leaders, supporting climate-friendly businesses, and participating in community initiatives, individuals can push for the systemic changes that are urgently needed.

In conclusion, both individuals and institutions share the responsibility to combat climate change, but their roles differ in scale and nature. Governments and corporations must lead with policies and innovation, yet individuals cannot remain passive observers. By making sustainable choices and demanding action from leaders, people can amplify the global effort. Ultimately, fighting climate change requires a partnership between collective will and institutional power.

text:
La Tecnología en la Vida Diaria

La tecnología se ha convertido en una parte esencial de nuestra rutina diaria, transformando la manera en que trabajamos, estudiamos y nos comunicamos. Gracias a los avances tecnológicos, muchas tareas que antes requerían tiempo y esfuerzo ahora son más rápidas y eficientes. Por ejemplo, los teléfonos inteligentes nos permiten estar conectados con familiares y amigos en cualquier momento y lugar. Además, el acceso a internet facilita el aprendizaje en línea y el trabajo remoto, ofreciendo comodidad y flexibilidad.

Sin embargo, el uso excesivo de la tecnología también tiene aspectos negativos. Pasar demasiado tiempo frente a las pantallas puede afectar la salud física, como la vista o la postura, y puede generar adicción a redes sociales. Además, la dependencia de los dispositivos electrónicos reduce el contacto personal y, a veces, interfiere en nuestras relaciones cara a cara.

En conclusión, la tecnología influye de manera positiva al hacernos la vida más sencilla y eficiente, pero también presenta desafíos que debemos gestionar con responsabilidad. Encontrar un equilibrio entre su uso y el tiempo desconectado es clave para aprovechar sus beneficios sin afectar nuestra salud y relaciones.

La tecnología se ha convertido en una parte esencial de nuestra rutina diaria, transformando la manera en que trabajamos, estudiamos y nos comunicamos. Gracias a los avances tecnológicos, muchas tareas que antes requerían tiempo y esfuerzo ahora son más rápidas y eficientes. Por ejemplo, los teléfonos inteligentes nos permiten estar conectados con familiares y amigos en cualquier momento y lugar. Además, el acceso a internet facilita el aprendizaje en línea y el trabajo remoto, ofreciendo comodidad y flexibilidad en casi todas las actividades cotidianas.

text:
A place that is very special to me is my village. Surrounded by greenery, open fields, and peaceful silence, it gives me a sense of comfort and relaxation that I cannot find in busy cities. I like visiting my village because it reminds me of simplicity and closeness to nature. Waking up to the sound of birds, breathing fresh air, and walking through the farms make me feel refreshed and happy.

Another reason I like this place is the people. Everyone in the village is friendly, caring, and supportive. Spending time with family and neighbors creates strong bonds and unforgettable memories. For me, my village is not just a location but a place of love, peace, and belonging.

text:
Do Individuals Have a Real Responsibility to Fight Climate Change, or Is It Mainly the Role of Governments and Companies?

Climate change is one of the most pressing challenges of our time, affecting ecosystems, economies, and human health worldwide. While governments and corporations possess the resources and authority to enact large-scale policies and technological changes, individuals also play a crucial role in combating climate change. This essay argues that although systemic action from governments and companies is essential, individuals have a real and meaningful responsibility to contribute to the fight against climate change.

Firstly, individual actions collectively shape demand, which in turn influences corporate and governmental decisions. For example, when more people choose to use public transportation or electric vehicles instead of gasoline-powered cars, it reduces overall carbon emissions and pushes the automobile industry to invest in cleaner technologies. Similarly, consumers who prefer eco-friendly products encourage companies to adopt sustainable production methods. These small choices may seem insignificant on their own, but together they create powerful market shifts.

Secondly, individuals have a direct impact on energy consumption and waste reduction at home. Simple actions—such as turning off unnecessary lights, reducing water usage, composting organic waste, and recycling—help reduce greenhouse gas emissions. For instance, if households worldwide reduced food waste by half, millions of tons of methane, a potent greenhouse gas, could be avoided each year. These measures are affordable, accessible, and collectively significant in mitigating climate change.

However, it would be unrealistic to place the primary burden solely on individuals. Governments and corporations control large-scale industrial emissions, infrastructure development, and energy production—areas where personal choices have limited influence. For example, without policies that regulate emissions from factories or promote renewable energy, the efforts of individuals alone cannot offset the vast amount of greenhouse gases produced by industrial sectors. Thus, systemic changes led by authorities are indispensable.

Critics argue that emphasizing individual responsibility distracts from the need for structural reforms. While this concern is valid, personal actions and advocacy can complement rather than replace institutional efforts. By voting for environmentally conscious leaders, supporting climate-friendly businesses, and participating in community initiatives, individuals can push for the systemic changes that are urgently needed.

In conclusion, both individuals and institutions share the responsibility to combat climate change, but their roles differ in scale and nature. Governments and corporations must lead with policies and innovation, yet individuals cannot remain passive observers. By making sustainable choices and demanding action from leaders, people can amplify the global effort. Ultimately, fighting climate change requires a partnership between collective will and institutional power.

(Word count: ~404 words)

The focus is more on individual actions rather than collaborative efforts.  Mentioning how individuals can support government policies or corporate initiatives would strengthen the teamwork aspect.

scores.label: Organization
scores.comment: The essay has a clear introduction and conclusion, and the two main points are presented logically.  The structure is well-organized.

scores.label: Examples
scores.comment: The essay provides good examples, such as choosing public transport and eco-friendly products, and reducing food waste.  These examples illustrate the impact of individual actions.

scores.label: Language
scores.comment: The language is generally clear and simple, but could be improved by using more varied vocabulary.  For example, instead of just saying 'reduce,' using terms like 'mitigate' or 'minimize' would enhance the writing.

scores.label: Reflection
scores.comment: The essay explains the importance of individual actions, but does not fully explain how these actions contribute to a larger team effort.  There's a lack of discussion on how individual actions can support broader systemic change or how individuals can collaborate to achieve a common goal.

feedback: The essay is a good starting point for discussing the importance of individual actions in climate change.  However, to fully address the challenge of "teamwork," it needs to explicitly show how individual actions contribute to a larger, collaborative effort.  More emphasis on collective action and support for government/corporate initiatives would strengthen the essay's argument.

text:
The Importance of Teamwork

Teamwork is an essential skill that plays a significant role in both school and everyday life. It allows people to combine their strengths, share ideas, and work toward a common goal. When students collaborate on projects or group activities, they can divide tasks according to their abilities. This not only saves time but also encourages each member to contribute their best efforts.

In school, teamwork helps students learn from each other. For example, a student good at research can assist others, while another skilled in presenting can lead discussions. This exchange of knowledge builds confidence and strengthens problem-solving skills. Teamwork also teaches patience, communication, and respect for different opinions—qualities that are essential for success in the real world.

In life, almost every profession requires working with others. Doctors, engineers, teachers, and athletes achieve better results by cooperating with their teams. By working together, people can overcome challenges that might seem too difficult alone.

In conclusion, teamwork is more than just sharing responsibilities; it fosters learning, friendship, and growth. Developing teamwork skills early in school prepares individuals to face future challenges effectively and achieve their goals through unity and collaboration.

scores.label: Content Relevance
scores.comment: While the essay touches on the importance of teamwork, it lacks depth.  The explanation of how teamwork fosters learning and growth could be more detailed and specific.

scores.label: Organization
scores.comment: The essay has a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion. The structure is logical.

scores.label: Examples
scores.comment: The essay provides a general example of students collaborating on projects.  More specific examples or anecdotes would strengthen the argument.

scores.label: Language
scores.comment: The vocabulary is generally simple and accessible, but there's room for more varied and sophisticated language to enhance the writing.

scores.label: Reflection
scores.comment: The essay mentions the importance of teamwork, but doesn't fully explain *why* it's so crucial.  The reflection on the personal and professional benefits could be more insightful.

feedback: The essay demonstrates a basic understanding of teamwork.  To improve, the writer should provide more specific examples, explore the deeper implications of teamwork, and use more varied language to strengthen the argument.

text:
The Importance of Teamwork

Teamwork is an essential skill that plays a significant role in both school and everyday life. It allows people to combine their strengths, share ideas, and work toward a common goal. When students collaborate on projects or group activities, they can divide tasks according to their abilities. This not only saves time but also encourages each member to contribute their best efforts.

In school, teamwork helps students learn from each other. For example, a student good at research can assist others, while another skilled in presenting can lead discussions. This exchange of knowledge builds confidence and strengthens problem-solving skills. Teamwork also teaches patience, communication, and respect for different opinions—qualities that are essential for success in the real world.

In life, almost every profession requires working with others. Doctors, engineers, teachers, and athletes achieve better results by cooperating with their teams. By working together, people can overcome challenges that might seem too difficult alone.

In conclusion, teamwork is more than just sharing responsibilities; it fosters learning, friendship, and growth. Developing teamwork skills early in school prepares individuals to face future challenges effectively and achieve their goals through unity and collaboration.

text: My favorite hobby is reading books. I enjoy reading because it takes me to different worlds and lets me explore new ideas. Whether it’s fiction, adventure, or self-help, every book teaches me something valuable. Reading helps me relax after a long day and sparks my imagination. It also improves my vocabulary and communication skills, which is useful in school and life. I especially love reading stories with strong characters and exciting plots. This hobby makes me feel happy and inspired, and I can spend hours with a good book without noticing the time pass.This is all about my hobby. That's it.

text:
Climate change is one of the most urgent global challenges of our time, threatening ecosystems, economies, and human well-being. While governments and corporations play major roles in shaping environmental policies and practices, individuals also bear responsibility. Each person’s daily choices contribute to either worsening or mitigating climate change. Therefore, individuals do have a real responsibility to fight climate change, even though large-scale actions by governments and companies are crucial for broader systemic change.

Firstly, individual actions collectively have a significant environmental impact. Simple habits such as reducing electricity use, minimizing waste, and choosing public transport over private vehicles can reduce carbon emissions. For instance, if millions of people switched to energy-efficient appliances or reduced single-use plastics, the cumulative effect would be substantial. Public participation in sustainable practices creates a culture of responsibility and signals to industries and governments that citizens care about the planet. This, in turn, can influence policies and corporate decisions.

Secondly, consumer behavior has the power to shape market trends. When individuals demand eco-friendly products or boycott brands that harm the environment, companies are forced to adapt. For example, the rise in popularity of electric vehicles and plant-based diets has been driven largely by consumer demand. These shifts push industries toward greener innovation. Thus, individuals act as catalysts for change, driving corporations to adopt sustainable business models and invest in renewable energy.

However, it is true that governments and corporations hold the greatest power to address climate change effectively. Large-scale problems such as deforestation, industrial pollution, and fossil fuel dependency require policies, regulations, and technological advancements that individuals alone cannot implement. Governments can enforce carbon taxes, promote renewable energy, and regulate emissions. Likewise, corporations have the resources to invest in clean technology and reduce industrial waste. Without their commitment, individual efforts may seem small and insufficient.

Despite this, it would be wrong to conclude that individuals have no role. Governments and companies often respond to public opinion and social movements. When citizens take responsibility—by voting for leaders with green policies, joining climate campaigns, and practicing sustainable lifestyles—they create political and social pressure for large-scale change. Personal responsibility complements, rather than replaces, institutional action.

In conclusion, fighting climate change is a shared responsibility. While governments and corporations must lead through policies and innovation, individuals play a vital supporting role through conscious choices and advocacy. Every action, no matter how small, contributes to a collective effort toward a sustainable future. Climate change demands unity—a partnership between citizens, businesses, and governments—to protect the planet for generations to come.
